reviews.review_msg: Super shocked by his low ratings on here tbh This man is an absolute gem. He teaches a super laid back class with tons of interesting content. A great example of a prof who is passionate about his topics of choice and also about teaching them. He sets you up for success and goes over practical stuff (how to cite, how to use the archives etc) 10/10

At least in my experience he was not racist. I'm not sure how he was racist to students since he was a pretty nice professor, but like any course you really need to read the material and put in your work. Do that and you should be fine. He was pretty chill in my experience.

Liam's been a pleasure to have, content is great and the course is comprised of short tutorials, weekly course diaries and one fairly big but conceptually cool project. Highly reccomend him if you are interested in history.

I don't know what weird ideals this guy has about grades, but at the end of the day I need to do well in this course so I can get into teacher school and hopefully get myself a decent job. I would like a clear cut rubric and a word count, please
If you at all listened in your past 12 years of history schooling, you'll learn nothing new.
I will never recommend you guys to take this professor ever again......he is worst worst. even if u r on death bed he will still need attendance.

The professor does not understand what you r going through, he will do nothing to help you. 
Dont take this course. 
Rather take other professors who are mindful and helping.
It was perfect, perfect, everything down to the last-minute details.

Liam is probably one of the most caring professors I've ever had the privilege of learning from. He not only puts in the effort to get to know his students but he also takes our workloads into consideration. Not many professors care about other stressors in your life but he does. Would definitely take another course with Liam again!

Liam is very passionate about what he does. He is caring and nice, active listener. If you like history and shows the interest, speaking up your points of view, you will be fine. It is important to prepare, participate, and do the homework. It is not tough and you can negotiate anything you have problems with anytime.

Liam is very considerate with his feedback and makes his best effort for you to learn. As long as you read the readings before tutorial and have an opinion to be heard, you will be fine. He actually made learning about Canada more interesting than I expected. Hard to find nice profs like him, if you have the chance take his class !!

Liam is super caring and gives really good, thorough feedback. I've taken two classes with him and initially it can seem like he's a tough grader but he just pays close attention to the specific details in your papers, which for an upper division history course should not be surprising. Most of the assignments are based on readings. He's great tbh

I've only had Liam for upper division writing courses, but I can tell he really cares about his content and his students. Sure, the marks come back within a couple weeks but that's because he takes time to actually give proper, detailed feedback. He's very encouraging, a fair marker, and a calm teacher that makes it easy to learn and take risks.

For a 100 class, Liam's expectations were crazy high, especially for a 100 level writing course. Although the papers were small, the level of detail required and very hard marking from the TA's made this class miserable. Do not expect him to be supportive when you reach out to him to help. Oh, and lectures are essentially useless for assignments.

In general, Liam is a good choice for all the other professor's present there in FIC and SFU. HIST102 is a pretty easy and more of a writing course you can say. But beware this professor changes the syllabus every term. So, that the students don't copy-paste their work from other students. Now, for attendance he's pretty harsh with markings there.
